member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAutoBarIndicator
member.summary: The RTAutoBarIndicator is a ChartView derived object that encapsulates all of the chart elements needed to draw a process control style bargraph, including a RTProcessVar object, a coordinate system, axes, axes labels, a RTBarIndicator, RTAlarmSymbol alarm symbols, and RTPanelMeter objects for the display of numeric values, alarm status, a title and units strings.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAutoClockIndicator.SetMeterFrame(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initialize a clock object using he specified parameters.
member.param: Specifies the starting arc angle position of the clock arc in degrees.
Specifies the extent of the clock arc in degrees. The default clock arc starts at startArcAngle and extends in a negative (clockwise) direction with an extent arcExtent.
Specifies the scaling value associated with the startArcAngle position of the clock arc.
Specifies the scaling value associated with the ending position of the clock arc.

Specifies the direction of the arcExtent. The default arcDirectionPositive value of false clock arc starts at startArcAngle and extends in a negative (clockwise) direction with an extent arcExtent. Change to true to have the clock arc extend in a positive (counter-clockwise) direction.
Specifies x-position of the center of the clock arc in plot area normalized coordinates.
Specifies y-position of the center of the clock arc in plot area normalized coordinates.
Specifies radius of the clock arc in plot area normalized coordinates.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAutoMeterIndicator
member.summary: The RTAutoMeterIndicator is a ChartView derived object that encapsulates all of the chart elements needed to draw a process control style meter, including a RTProcessVar object, a meter coordinate system, meter axes, meter axes labels, a RTMeterIndicator, and RTPanelMeter objects for the display of numeric values, alarm status, a title and units strings.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAutoMeterIndicator.SetMeterFrame(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initialize a meter object using he specified parameters.
member.param: Specifies the starting arc angle position of the meter arc in degrees.
Specifies the extent of the meter arc in degrees. The default meter arc starts at startArcAngle and extends in a negative (clockwise) direction with an extent arcExtent.
Specifies the scaling value associated with the startArcAngle position of the meter arc.
Specifies the scaling value associated with the ending position of the meter arc.

Specifies the direction of the arcExtent. The default arcDirectionPositive value of false meter arc starts at startArcAngle and extends in a negative (clockwise) direction with an extent arcExtent. Change to true to have the meter arc extend in a positive (counter-clockwise) direction.
Specifies x-position of the center of the meter arc in plot area normalized coordinates.
Specifies y-position of the center of the meter arc in plot area normalized coordinates.
Specifies radius of the meter arc in plot area normalized coordinates.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAutoScrollGraph
member.summary: The RTAutoScrollGraph is a ChartView derived object that encapsulates all of the chart elements needed to draw a scrolling graph, including an array of RTProcessVar objects, a coordinate system, axes, axes labels, RTSingleValuePlot, RTGroupMultiValuePlot, RTAlarmSymbol alarm symbols, legend, title, subhead, footer and units strings. Only horizontal scrolling modes are supported.

member.summary: The SimpleDataset that holds the data used to plot the scroll graph.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RT3DFrame
member.summary: This class is used to draw 3D borders and provide the background for many of the other graph objects, most noticeably the RTPanelMeter classes. It can also be used directly in your program to provide 3D frames the visually group objects together in a faceplate format.

member.summary: Specifies the location and size of the 3D frame.

member.summary: Specifies the apparent direction of the light source used to highlight the 3D frame. Use one of the direction constants: LIGHT_UPPER_LEFT, LIGHT_UPPER_RIGHT, LIGHT_LOWER_LEFT, LIGHT_LOWER_RIGHT , LIGHT_STRAIGHT_ON , LIGHT_NONE, OUTSET_3D_LOOK, INSET_3D_LOOK.

member.summary: Specifies the highlight color of the 3D frame.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RT3DFrame.bevelAlgorithmXOver
member.summary: Bevels are drawn in two ways. For narrow bevels of less than bevelAlgorithmXOver in width the bevels are drawn using straight lines. Otherwise the bevels are drawn using polygon fills.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm
member.summary: Summary description for the RTAlarm class.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmType
member.summary: The RTAlarm class stores alarm information for the RTProcessVar class. The RTAlarm class specifies the type of the alarm, the alarm color, alarm text messages and alarm hysteresis value. The RTProcessVar classes can hold an unlimited number of RTAlarm objects in a ArrayList.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmLimitValue
member.summary: Specifies the alarm limit value.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmDeviationBaseValue
member.summary: Specifies the alarm deviation base value: Unused.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.hysteresisValue
member.summary: Specifies the hysteresis value used in the alarm module. A process variable will go into alarm when the alarmLimitValue is exceeded, it will fall out of alarm when the process value is less than alarmLimitValue - hysteresisValue.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmState
member.summary: Specifies true if the process variable is currently in alarm.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.prevAlarmState
member.summary: Specifies the previous alarm state, last time the alarm was checked.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmEnable
member.summary: Specifies true if alarm checking is enabled.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmDisplay
member.summary: Specifies true if auto graphics should display alarm indicators for this alarm.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmSymbolColor
member.summary: Specifies default alarm symbol color. Unused

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmTextColor
member.summary: Specifies default alarm text color. Unused

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.normalMessage
member.summary: Specifies message string displayed when there is no alarm.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.alarmMessage
member.summary: Specifies message string displayed when in an alarm state.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAlarm.ackAlarmMessage
member.summary: Specifies message string displayed when in an alarm state but the alarm is acknowledged. Unused.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAnnunciator
member.summary: An RTAnnunciator is used to display the current values and alarm states of a single channel real-time data. It consists of a rectangular cell that can contain the tag name, units, current value, and alarm status message. Any of these items may be excluded. If a channel is in alarm, the background of the corresponding cell changes its color, giving a strong visual indication that an alarm has occurred.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAnnunciator.CalcNearestPoint(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,System.Int32,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAnnunciator.CheckIntersection(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: Returns true if the test point intersects the annunciator.
member.param: The test point
Nearest point information for data based objects.
member.returns: Returns true if the test point intersects the annunciator.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTAutoVerticalScrollGraph
member.summary: The RTAutoVerticalScrollGraph is a ChartView derived object that encapsulates all of the chart elements needed to draw a scrolling graph, including an array of RTProcessVar objects, a coordinate system, axes, axes labels, RTSingleValuePlot, RTGroupMultiValuePlot, RTAlarmSymbol alarm symbols, and RTPanelMeter objects for the display of numeric values, alarm status, a title and units strings. Only horizontal scrolling modes are supported.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTBarIndicator
member.summary: An RTBarIndicator is used to display the current value of an RTProcessVar using a bar changing its size. One end of each bar is always fixed at the specified base value. Bars can change their size either in vertical or horizontal direction. Sub types within the RTBarIndicator class support segmented bars, custom segmented bars with variable width segments, and pointer bar indicators.An RTBarIndicator is used to display the current value of an RTProcessVar using a bar changing its size. One end of each bar is always fixed at the specified base value. Bars can change their size either in vertical or horizontal direction. Sub types within the RTBarIndicator class support segmented bars, custom segmented bars with variable width segments, and pointer bar indicators.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTBarIndicator.indicatorSubType

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTBarIndicator.CalcNearestPoint(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,System.Int32,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTBarIndicator.CheckIntersection(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: Returns true if the test point intersects one of the bar plot bars.
member.param: The test point
Nearest point information for data based objects.
member.returns: Returns true if the test point intersects one of the bar plot bars.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTComboProcessVar
member.summary: Summary description for the RTComboProcessVar class. This class transforms a single value in a group of values suitable for use with clocks and dials that have an underlying modulo-n display algorithm.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTComboProcessVar.processVarsList
member.summary: A list of the process variables where the converted value is stored.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTComboProcessVar.moduloList
member.summary: An array of the modulo factors used to calculate the combo process variables. processVarsList[i].Current = (this.CurrentValue / divisorList[i]) % moduloList[i];

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTComboProcessVar.divisorList
member.summary: An array of the divisors used to calculate the combo process variables processVarsList[i].Current = (this.CurrentValue / divisorList[i]) % moduloList[i];

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTFormControlGrid.CalcNearestPoint(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,System.Int32,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.summary: Returns true if the test point intersects one of the grid objectys.
member.param: The test point
Nearest point information for data based objects.
member.returns: Returns true if the test point intersects one of the grid objects.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot
member.summary: The RTGroupMultiValuePlot plot class uses a template based on the QCChart2D GroupPlot class to create a real-time plot that displays a collection of RTProcessVar objects as a group plot in a scrolling graph.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.plotTemplate
member.summary: This field holds a reference to a GroupPlot object that serves as a template for the RTGroupMultiValuePlot plot object.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.groupdataset
member.summary: This field holds a reference to a GroupDataset made from the RTProcessVar objects in RTMultProcessVar.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.endOfPlotLineMarker
member.summary: The end of plot marker type. Use one of the Marker marker type constants: MARKER_NULL, MARKER_VLINE, MARKER_HLINE, MARKER_HVLINE.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.markerGroupNumber
member.summary: This value specifies which plot in a group plot is used to position the end of plot marker.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.sweepMode
member.summary: Specifies that a sweep mode display is enabled, where older data is placed in front of the sweep line, and newer data before the sweep line.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.InitDefaults
member.summary: Initializes default values for the RTMultiValueIndicator object.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.CalcNearestPoint(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,System.Int32,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTGroupMultiValuePlot.CheckIntersection(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: Returns true if the test point intersects the object.
member.param: The test point
Nearest point information for data based objects.
member.returns: Returns true if the test point intersects the object.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterArcIndicator
member.summary: This RTMeterArcIndicator class displays the current RTProcessVar value as an arc. Segmented meter arcs are one of the RTMeterArcIndicator subtypes.

member.summary: Specifies the inner radius of the arc in normalized radius coordinates.

member.summary: Specifies the outer radius of the arc in normalized radius coordinates.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterArcIndicator.segmentWidth
member.summary: Specifies the sweep, in degrees, of a single segment of a segmented arc.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterArcIndicator.segmentSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the space between adjacent segments, in degrees, of a segmented arc.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterArcIndicator.segmentValueRoundMode
member.summary: Specifies that the current process value is rounded up in calculating how many segments to display in RT_METER_SEGMENTED_ARC_SUBTYPE, RT_METER_SINGLE_SEGMENT_ARC_SUBTYPE modes. Use one of the constants: RT_FLOOR_VALUE, RT_CEILING_VALUE.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterArcIndicator.outerArcCapStyle
member.summary: Specifies how the outer cap of the segment arc is drawn in RT_METER_SEGMENTED_ARC_SUBTYPE, RT_METER_SINGLE_SEGMENT_ARC_SUBTYPE modes. Use one of the constants:RT_METER_ARC_RADIUS_CAP, RT_METER_ARC_WEDGE_WIDTH_CAP, RT_METER_ARC_FLAT_CAP.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterArcIndicator.innerArcCapStyle

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterAxis
member.summary: A meter axis extends for the extent of the meter arc and is centered on the origin. Major and minor tick marks are placed at evenly spaced intervals perpendicular to the meter arc. The meter axis also draws meter alarm arcs using the alarm information in the associated RTProcessVar object.

member.summary: Specify true if the meter axis alarm arcs are to be displayed.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterCoordinates
member.summary: A meter coordinate system has more properties than a simple Cartesian coordinate system, or even a polar coordinate system. Because of the variation in meter styles, a meter coordinate system sets the start and end angle of the meter arc within the 360 degree polar coordinate system. It also maps a physical coordinate system, representing the meter scale, on top of the meter arc. And the origin of the meter coordinate system can be offset in both x- and y-directions with respect to the containing plot area.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterCoordinates.startArcAngle
member.summary: Specifies the starting arc angle position of the meter arc in degrees.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterCoordinates.arcExtent
member.summary: Specifies the extent of the meter arc in degrees. The default meter arc starts at startArcAngle and extends in a negative (clockwise) direction with an extent arcExtent.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterCoordinates.arcDirectionPositive
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the arcExtent. The default arcDirectionPositive value of false meter arc starts at startArcAngle and extends in a negative (clockwise) direction with an extent arcExtent. Change to true to have the meter arc extend in a positive (counter-clockwise) direction.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterCoordinates.startArcScale
member.summary: Specifies the scaling value associated with the startArcAngle position of the meter arc.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterCoordinates.endArcScale
member.summary: Specifies the scaling value associated with the ending position of the meter arc.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterCoordinates.arcRadius
member.summary: Specifies radius of the meter arc in plot area normalized coordinates.

member.summary: Specifies x-position of the center of the meter arc in plot area normalized coordinates.

member.summary: Specifies y-position of the center of the meter arc in plot area normalized coordinates.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterIndicator
member.summary: The RTMeterIndicator class is the abstract base class for all meter indicators. Familiar examples of analog meters are voltmeters, car speedometers, pressure gages, compasses and analog clock faces. Three meter types are supported: arc, symbol, and needle meters. An unlimited number of meter indicators can be added to a given meter object. RTPanelMeter objects can be attached to an RTMeterIndicator object for the display of RTProcessVar numeric, alarm and string data in addition to the indicator graphical display. Meter scaling, meter axes, meter axis labels and alarm objects and handle by other classes. classes.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterIndicator.underRangeNormalizedValue
member.summary: Specifies the displayable low end of the indicator range as a normalized value based on the RTMeterCoordinates and RTMeterAxis scale. For example, if the RTMeterAxis scale is 0 to 10, an underRangeNormalizedValue of -0.1 will allow the indicator to display off-scale down to -1.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterIndicator.overRangeNormalizedValue
member.summary: Specifies the displayable high end of the indicator range as a normalized value based on the RTMeterCoordinates and RTMeterAxis scale. For example, if the RTMeterAxis scale is 0 to 10, an overRangeNormalizedValue of 0.1 will allow the indicator to display off-scale up to 11.0.

member.summary: Holds a reference to the RTMeterAxis associated with the meter indicator.

member.summary: Specifies the meter indicator subtype. member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterNeedleIndicator
member.summary: This RTMeterNeedleIndicator class displays the current RTProcessVar value as a needle. Subtypes of the RTMeterNeedleIndicator are simple needles, pie wedge shaped needles and arrow needles.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterNeedleIndicator.needleOverhang
member.summary: Specifies the overhang of the back end of the needle indicator specified as a fraction of the needle length. For example: a value of 0.25 means that the needle will extend the point, back through the RTMeterCoordinates arcCenterX, and arcCenterY point, and continue for a distance equal to 0.25 of the radius value.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMeterSymbolIndicator
member.summary: This RTMeterSymbolIndicator class displays the current RTProcessVar value as a symbol moving around in the meter arc. Symbols include all of the QCChart2D scatter plot symbols: SQUARE, TRIANGLE, DIAMOND, CROSS, PLUS, STAR, LINE, HBAR, VBAR, BAR3D, CIRCLE.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator
member.summary: An RTMultiBarIndicator is used to display the current value of a collection of RTProcessVar objects using a group of bars changing size. The bars are always fixed at the specified base value. Bars can change their size either in vertical or horizontal direction. Sub types within the RTMultiBarIndicator class support segmented bars, custom segmented bars with variable width segments, and pointer bar indicators.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.indicatorSubType
member.summary: Specifies the bar indicator sub type: RT_BAR_SOLID_SUBTYPE, RT_BAR_SEGMENTED_SUBTYPE, RT_BAR_SINGLE_SEGMENT_SUBTYPE, RT_POINTER_SUBTYPE.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.barOffset
member.summary: Specifies the bar offset from its fixed x or y value in physical units.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.segmentWidth
member.summary: Specifies the thickness of a segmented bars segment in physical units.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.segmentSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the spacing between segmented bars segments in physical units.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.indicatorBackground
member.summary: Specifies the background attributes of the indicator display area.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.indicatorBackgroundEnable
member.summary: Set to True if indicatorBackground is on.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.segmentValueRoundMode
member.summary: Specifies that the current process value is rounded up in calculating how many segments to display in RT_BAR_SEGMENTED_SUBTYPE and RT_BAR_SINGLE_SEGMENT_SUBTYPE modes. Use one of the constants: RT_FLOOR_VALUE, RT_CEILING_VALUE.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.segmentCornerRadius
member.summary: Specifies the corner radius used to draw the segment rounded rectangles.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.barEndBulb
member.summary: True and a bulb is drawn at the minimum endpoint of the bar indicator.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.barEndBulbScaleFactor
member.summary: Bulb bar end scale factor (multiplier times bar width).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.barEndBulbOffset
member.summary: Bulb bar end offset factor (multiplier times bar width).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.barBulbSymbol
member.summary: The ChartSymbol object used as the bar bulb.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.pointerSymbolNum
member.summary: Specifies the symbol used for the pointer symbol indicator subtype, RT_POINTER_SUBTYPE. Use one of the constants: RT_NO_SYMBOL, RT_LEFT_LOW_ALARM_SYMBOL.RT_LEFT_SETPOINT_SYMBOL. RT_LEFT_HIGH_ALARM_SYMBOL , RT_RIGHT_LOW_ALARM_SYMBOL, RT_RIGHT_SETPOINT_SYMBOL, RT_RIGHT_HIGH_ALARM_SYMBOL, RT_TOP_LOW_ALARM_SYMBOL , RT_TOP_SETPOINT_SYMBOL, RT_TOP_HIGH_ALARM_SYMBOL, RT_BOTTOM_LOW_ALARM_SYMBOL, RT_BOTTOM_SETPOINT_SYMBOL, RT_BOTTOM_HIGH_ALARM_SYMBOL;

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiBarIndicator.CalcNearestPoint(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,System.Int32,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.param: The test point

member.returns: Returns true if the test point intersects one of the bar plot bars.

member.name: P:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiProcessVar.AutoTruncateDataset
member.summary: Set to true and updates of the all of the chart datasets automatically truncate when the number of data points reaches autoTruncateMaxCount. It truncates the number of points in the dataset to autoTruncateMinCount. In order for the RTMultiProcessVar auto-truncate to work, the internal RTProcessVar objects must be updated using one of the RTMultiProcessVar.SetCurrentValue methods, and NOT updated on an individual basis.

member.name: P:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiProcessVar.AutoTruncateMaxCount
member.summary: If the autoTruncate flag is true updates of the datasets automatically truncate when the number of data points reaches autoTruncateMaxCount. It truncates the number of points in the data set to autoTruncateMinCount. In order for the RTMultiProcessVar auto-truncate to work, the internal RTProcessVar objects must be updated using one of the RTMultiProcessVar.SetCurrentValue methods, and NOT updated on an individual basis.

member.name: P:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiProcessVar.AutoTruncateMinCount
member.summary: If the autoTruncate flag is true updates of the datasets automatically truncate when the number of data points reaches autoTruncateMaxCount. It truncates the number of points in the data set to autoTruncateMinCount. In order for the RTMultiProcessVar auto-truncate to work, the internal RTProcessVar objects must be updated using one of the RTMultiProcessVar.SetCurrentValue methods, and NOT updated on an individual basis.

member.name: P:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiProcessVar.Count

In order for the RTMultiProcessVar auto-truncate to work, the internal RTProcessVar objects must be updated using one of the RTMultiProcessVar.SetCurrentValue methods, and NOT updated on an individual basis.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiValueAnnunciator
member.summary: An RTMultiValueAnnunciator is used to display the current values and alarm states of a collection of RTProcessVar objects. It consists of a rectangular grid with individual channels represented by the rows and columns in of the grid. Each grid cell can contain the tag name, units, current value, and alarm status message for a single RTProcessVar object. Any of these items may be excluded. If a channel is in alarm, the background of the corresponding cell changes its color, giving a strong visual indication that an alarm has occurred.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTMultiValueAnnunciator.CalcNearestPoint(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,System.Int32,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.summary: Returns true if the test point intersects one of the annunciator cells.
member.param: The test point
Nearest point information for data based objects.
member.returns: Returns true if the test point intersects one of the annunciator cells.

member.summary: The abstract base class for the panel meter types. Panel meters based objects can be added to RTSingleValueIndicator and RTMultiValueIndicator objects to enhance the graphics display with numeric, alarm and string information. The RTNumericPanelMeter, RTAlarmPanelMeter, RTStringPanelMeter and RTTimePanelMeter classes are described in the preceding section.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTPanelMeter.CalcNearestPoint(com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.Point2D,System.Int32,com.quinncurtis.chart2dnet.NearestPointData)
member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.summary: Returns true if the test point intersects the panel meter rectangle.
member.param: The test point
Nearest point information for data based objects.
member.returns: Returns true if the test point intersects the panel meter rectangle.

member.summary: Real-time data is stored in RTProcessVar classes. The RTProcessVar class is designed to represent a single process variable, complete with limit values, an unlimited number of high and low alarms, historical data storage, and descriptive strings for use in displays.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTProcessVarViewer
member.summary: The RTProcessVarViewer is a UserControl derived object that is used to view a RTProcessVar dataset. Since it is usually not possible or practical to display the entire dataset, the RTProcessVarViewer windows a rectangular section of the dataset for display. Scroll bars can be used to scroll the rows and columns of the dataset.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTScrollFrame
member.summary: The scrolling algorithm used in this software is different that in earlier Quinn-Curtis real-time graphics products. Scrolling plots are no longer updated incrementally whenever the underlying data is updated. Instead, the underlying RTProcessVar data objects are updated as fast as you want. Scrolling graphs (all graphs for that matter) are only updated with the ChartView.UpdateDraw() method is called. What makes scrolling graphs appear to scroll is the scroll frame (RTScrollFrame). When a scroll frame is updated as a result of the ChartView.UpdateDraw() event, it analyze the RTSimpleSingleValuePlot and RTGroupMultiValuePlot objects that have been attached to it and creates a coordinate system that matches the current and historical data associated with the plot objects. The plot objects in the scroll frame are drawn into this coordinate system. As data progresses forward in time the coordinate system is constantly being rescaled to include the most recent time values as part of the x-coordinate system. You can control whether or not the starting point of the scroll frame coordinate system remains fixed, whether it advances in sync with the constantly changing end of the scroll frame. Other options allow the y-scale to be constantly rescaled to reflect the current dynamic range of the y-values in the scroll frame.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTScrollFrame.maxDisplayHistory
member.summary: The number of points in the display history for the fixed extent scroll modes

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTScrollFrame.scrollScaleModeX
member.summary: The scroll mode for the x-axis. Use one of the scroll mode constants: RT_NO_AUTOSCALE_X, RT_AUTOSCALE_X_CURRENT_SCALE, RT_AUTOSCALE_X_MIN, RT_AUTOSCALE_X_MAX, RT_AUTOSCALE_X_MINMAX, RT_FIXEDEXTENT_MOVINGSTART_AUTOSCROLL, RT_MAXEXTENT_FIXEDSTART_AUTOSCROLL, RT_FIXEDNUMPOINT_AUTOSCROLL

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTScrollFrame.scrollScaleModeY

member.summary: This method compares a test point against all of the xy points in a simple dataset and calculates which point in the dataset is nearest the test point. The nearness test has many different forms: Nearness Mode Constant Description FNP_X nearest x FNP_Y nearest y FNP_DIST shortest distance FNP_NORMX nearest normalized x FNP_NORMY nearest normalized y FNP_NORMDIST shortest normalized distance
member.param: The test point for the nearness calculation.
Specifies the algorithm used in the nearness calculation.
Returns the parameters of the nearest point.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid data point is found and returned.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTStringPanelMeter
member.summary: Displays a string in a RTPanelMeter format. It is used for titles, tag names and units strings. It contains a template based on the QCChart2D StringLabel class that is used to specify the font and format information associated with the panel meter.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTStringPanelMeter.stringType
member.summary: Displays a string, either an arbitrary string, or a string based on string data in the associated RTProcessVar object. It is usually used to display a channels tag string and units string, but it can also be used to display longer descriptive strings. It contains a template based on the QCChart2D StringLabel class that is used to specify the font and string format information associated with the panel meter. Specific what string to display, whether it is one of the process variable strings, or a custom string. Use one of the Panel Meter string constants: RT_CUSTOM_STRING, RT_TAG_STRING , RT_UNITS_STRING, RT_UNIQUEID_STRING, RT_SHORT_DESCRIPTION_STRING, RT_DETALED_DESCRIPTION_STRING.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTStringPanelMeter.stringTemplate

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTVerticalScrollFrame
member.summary: A scroll frame for vertical scrolling. The scrolling algorithm used in this software is different that in earlier Quinn-Curtis real-time graphics products. Scrolling plots are no longer updated incrementally whenever the underlying data is updated. Instead, the underlying RTProcessVar data objects are updated as fast as you want. Scrolling graphs (all graphs for that matter) are only updated with the ChartView.UpdateDraw() method is called. What makes scrolling graphs appear to scroll is the scroll frame (RTVerticalScrollFrame). When a scroll frame is updated as a result of the ChartView.UpdateDraw() event, it analyzes the RTSimpleSingleValuePlot and RTGroupMultiValuePlot objects that have been attached to it and creates a coordinate system that matches the current and historical data associated with the plot objects. The plot objects in the scroll frame are drawn into this coordinate system. As data progresses forward in time the coordinate system is constantly being rescaled to include the most recent time values as part of the y-coordinate system. You can control whether or not the starting point of the scroll frame coordinate system remains fixed, whether it advances in sync with the constantly changing end of the scroll frame. Other options allow the x-scale to be constantly rescaled to reflect the current dynamic range of the x-values in the scroll frame.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.rtgraphnet.RTVerticalScrollFrame.maxDisplayHistory
member.summary: The number of points in the display history for the fixed extent scroll modes

members.member: The scroll mode for the y-axis. Use one of the scroll mode constants: RT_NO_AUTOSCALE_Y, RT_AUTOSCALE_Y_CURRENT_SCALE, RT_AUTOSCALE_Y_MIN, RT_AUTOSCALE_Y_MAX, RT_AUTOSCALE_Y_MINMAX, RT_FIXEDEXTENT_MOVINGSTART_AUTOSCROLL, RT_MAXEXTENT_FIXEDSTART_AUTOSCROLL, RT_FIXEDNUMPOINT_AUTOSCROLL RT_FIXEDEXTENT_MOVINGSTART_AUTOSCROLL
